required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Association of Plasma PTX3 Concentration and Outcomes of STEMI
clinical_study.official_title: Association of Plasma Pentraxin 3 Concentration With Angiographic and Clinical Outcomes in STEMI Treated by Primary Angioplasty

brief_summary.textblock: 335 of patients with STEMI treated by primary PCI were assayed for PTX3 measurement by ELISA method. The angiographic and clinical outcomes were evaluated according to the PTX3 concentration.

detailed_description.textblock: 335 of patients with STEMI treated by primary PCI were assayed for PTX3 measurement by ELISA method using human PTX3 kit. Blood was drawn at the emergency department before primary PCI. The angiographic and clinical outcomes were evaluated and analyzed according to the PTX3 concentration. The angiographic outcome were thrombus grade on initial angiogram and final TIMI flow. The clinical outcome were ECG resolution after primary PCI and all-cause death at 30 days. The plasma PTX3 concentration was then compared based on the outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of thrombus grade 4&5 and final TIMI flow <3
primary_outcome.description: PTX3 concentration was compared based on the outcome

arm_group.description: First quartile, second quartile, third quartile and fourth quartile of PTX3 in ng/mL

intervention.description: Long pentraxin 3, thrombus burden, final TIMI flow, ST segment resolution, STEMI, primary PCI

study_pop.textblock: All patients with STEMI with symptom onset <12 h who admiited to the emergency department and planned for primary PCI.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with acute STEMI with symptom onset <12 h undergoing primary PCI
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute STEMI patients who received fibrinolytic therapy
